comment: I would not recommend this professor. I spent hours and hours working on papers for his class and never made anything above a C. It is impossible to know what he is looking for and he does not even care about grammer or technical erros it is just about agreeing with his opinion.

Dr. White is an extremely intelligent professor, and expects you to put some thought into your work.  If you are not willing to do that, then don't waste your (or his) time.  He was very fair, and was willing to give assistance to anyone that wanted it. I enjoyed the class very much, and he is one of the few professors that try to make KSU more tha

He does not want students to "side with him," in fact he rarely mentions his own beliefs. The papers do leave little room for personal opinion, but that is how philosophy is often written; you write about what other people think. Extremely erudite man. Very passionate about his subject. Very willing to stay and talk with students after class.

Do not take this professor! I am a strait A student and I do not miss classes. There is no way to know what he wants. I put more effort into my papers than I did in my comp. classes and could not get an A to save my life. I read the papers that got A's on the first go round and they were riddled w/ errors. Very full of himself!

Take this class. Dr. White understands the difference between teaching, and learning. He passes his knowledge onto his students, and you choose how much to take in. He is extremely knowledgeable about all things logic. Doesn't really provide anything you can't get from the book and many times just reads from it. Great class, though!

Dr. White has an extreme God complex; he will tell you that your logic is flawed simply because you do not agree with him.For an entry-level class, he is very critical.Assigns contemporary readings.Nothing traditional/classic like you might hope (Socrates, Plato or Aristotle). A-students may suffer: I have never made a lower grade in any class ever

Grades based on HIS opinion (be sure to learn his). Circled two grammar errors in one of my papers and the rest of the red pen was him disagreeing with my views. I'm not religious but he will tear you apart if you voice your religious opinions. He WILL ramble and make no sense. I came in with an open mind, but that only gets you so far.

Be prepared to keep your mouth shut if you have any sort of religous convictions as the basis for your philosophical view of the world.  He WILL tear your work apart if you side with religion.  Pay close attention to his views and be sure to side with him in your papers, sad but true because philosophy should be strictly personal.

Dr. White clearly wants to rebuke the Bible and it's contents.  If you are a religious person you will not pass because he will argue any point you try to make even if yours is clear he will scapegoat it with you are using "religious claims to argue your point." Yes, precisely what I am doing. His subject material is very inappropriate & unclassy

Do not take! He doesnt say anything the required reading hasn't already said. He contributes nothing new to the lecture-- he either tells irrelavent anecdotes or reads to the class from the text book. He is basically an overpaid test proctor.

It's philosophy.  The class is largely discussion and you need to come in with an open mind and a willingness to learn.  If you do this, you'll succeed in this class.  I found it extremely rewarding and Dr. White is a very intelligent man.  Stick to the text and use logic in your arguments. Three papers and he grades tough but fair.

He requires you to use logic and rational thinking to back up your arguments. Isn't that philosophy is supposed to be about? I thoroughly enjoyed this class and the critical thinking skills he required on each of the 3 papers we had to write. If you are a deep thinker,this class is for you. if you don't have a n open mind, don't pick this class.

Very interesting Class as a whole. Please do not take this class if you are dumb as they come. Leave Bible and religion out of the conversation unless you can defend your argument. I had fun in his class. There are 3 papers and are graded according to how well you answer HIS QUESTIONS. Stick to the BOOK. There is the reason for book assignments.

Logic is the worst class at kennesaw.  It has no use in the real world and makes no sense at all.  Also White makes no sense and just rambles on during class. he provides no help for students and just assumes you are on his level of understanding. DO NOT TAKE LOGIC 3305, It is worthless

THE WORSE PROFESSOR EVER!! I received an A on his first test after he swore the entire class would only get a C. He constantly berated the students in class and would correct people on how they pronounced words just to embarrass them. The grade was only based on 5 test and they were 5-6 pages long front and back. HORRIBLE teacher!! DONT TAKE!

Haha, the people that rated him a good teacher are absolutely crazy. This was the worst class I have ever taken. Listening to his lectures made me want to kill myself and even applying what he said to my papers didnt help. There are only 3 grades, plus he is so old he can hardly remember what he's saying. DO NOT TAKE.

He questions your faith by doing so, which is healthy for any religious follower.  It would be ignorant to adopt a view without reasons and THAT is why he pushes you!  Use your head and you'll do well.

The reason people are complaining about religious aspects of their paper is because you can NOT use faith to prove your point.  Leave morality out of it, think LOGICALLY and you may still use your own views.  If you can back up your views without saying "cause the bible says so" or "cause i have faith" then you can use YOUR own view in papers.
Its 3 papers.  Thats it.  Interesting lecture and a smart teacher.  If you can write and think philosophically then you're set.  As a freshman, I made an A and I am not an A student.  I'd take him.

DR. WHITE WAS BY FAR THE WORST PROF I HAVE HAD IN COLLEGE PERIOD!  BE SURE TO AGREE WITH HIS VIEWS AND BE SURE TO KEEP GOD OR ANY OTHER PERSONAL RELIGIOUS VIEWS AT A MINIMUM! I HATED THAT CLASS AND DO NOT RECOMMEND ANYONE TAKE HIM!!

Honestly my favorite class -- ever.  He takes attendance very seriously but I personally didn't find it necessary beyond learning the correct terminology to use when talking to him in class, because he is a stickler.  Read Klenk and be absolutely sure you can do any problem at the end of the chapters easily and you'll get an A.

He is a great professor but if you are new to college and dont know how to structure a philisopical argument you wont do well- (go to his office hours for help)!!.. 3 papers=your entire grade! I got a D+ on the first one which means the best you can do is a B+,He was helpful and nice- after explaining what he wanted in the papers I did fine. B+
Smartest teacher I have ever had.  This class is for people who care to learn.  I enjoy lecture as well as writing the essays.  Defend your reasoning.

This class is interesting and asks very little of students.  Write 3 papers, that's it.  Attend class.  Reading book isn't really necessary as long as you pay attention.  I'd suggest it to anybody who wants an interesting class and a tiny work load.
If you cant drop this class and are stuck in there, be sure to agree with all of his views because otherwise you will fail. Take very detailed notes with quotes from him

This is supposed to be an intro to philosophy but he takes the class to a whole other level. He teaches this class like you already know everything about philosophy. Way to deep for me. Avoid if you want an easy grade, or an intro to phil. His grading is horrible, and often contradicts himself in his comments on your graded papers.

Frequently off topic, and attendance is pretty much mandatory. Topics for papers are vague, no one in my class knew what he wanted for each assignment. Will grade people lower for disagreeing with him. Book assigned was useless and frequently painful to read, coincidentally it was written by someone he knew. Avoid if possible.
Prof White is a great teacher! Yes, sometimes debates will be boring but that's school. I would recommend him to anyone. He is a very nice teacher and is willing to help you if you need it.

I really liked this guy. He got a little off topic sometimes, but you could tell that he had a true passion for philosophy and really wanted his students to love it too. I'm not going to lie, he is definitley a tough teacher, but I really did learn a lot from him.

Worst professor I've ever had! The lectures are exceedingly boring since he blathers on and on and gets off track for more than half the class. You can't get a word in edgewise. He says you can write what you want but rips papers apart if they're not his view. Avoid if at all possible!

This is truly the worst professor I have had at KSU. Attendance is not mandatory, but it gets you a better grade. Only 3 grades - all philosophical papers! The final is also a paper. I ended up dropping after getting my first paper back - I got a D+. I fell asleep every class, even if I was on the internet! Don't take him if you need a B or higher!

Reading these unfavorable comments about Dr. White, I am reminded just how lazy Kennesaw students are. Dr. White is the ideal professor: extremely knowledgeable, able, and experienced in the field. And he conveys his knowledge well. Truly enjoys what he does. Grading systems for PHIL3305 and PHIL2200 are fair and reasonable, but not easy classes.

This teacher was good but kind of wierd. He answers a one word question with a paragraph. He always laughs when you ask a question and takes random points off for sig. figs. After three or so labs you can get used to his grading technique and start making high Bs or As on the lab reports. I made an A and it wasn't that time consuming.

Harsh grader. Says for you to speak your mind in papers but if you don't write siding with his views, trust me, you will fail Biased, and no matter how much you disagree with a view of his, he will tear you apart and say you are wrong. I was told in philosophy, there was no right or wrong answer. To him, his theories are right and yours are wrong.

Dr. White is a professor to take if you truly desire a challenge. He is remarkably well learned, and attempts to convey his knowledge to you. After taking his class, I feel I'm better informed on a litany of subjects, not simply philosophy. Fantastic guy, awesome professor. Only take him if you want a sincere challenge!!

Dr. White is the man! In his class, we examined the few stories we read very closely. This made me feel really comfortable with each story we went over. He is not too harsh on grading papers. Pay attention in class and try to make good philosophical points in your paper. Also, my favorite thing he would say in class was "Friend and menta."

He was a really nice teacher. He means well and is very interested in what he is teaching. However, If you were not a genius in high school and write precise papers... you are in trouble. I tend to avoid going to this class.

I took philosophy because people told me it was really interesting and fun. But White's class is the opposite. He lectures the whole entire time, and more than 1/2 that time he talks about things are are totally irrelevant. It's so boring and you only have 3 grades for the whole class, which sucks cause he grades pretty harshly.

He's a pretty cool guy with interesting stories, but an awful professor.  Goes off into 30 minute un-related tangents just to show how intelligent he really is.  Grading system SUCKS.  3 papers are the only grades and he gives no explanation of his grading system.  Cares more about length than quality of papers.  Don't take him.

I enjoyed this class, lots of class discussion that was very interesting, and the professor kept the discussion going and on topic, BUT, he has the worst grading system.  Randomly hands out grades and you cannot be creative on your papers with your words, you must use HIS words exactly or you will get nothing higher than a C.

I very much enjoyed this class.  It's an intro to philosophy,  covering a wide range of topics to give students an idea of what philosophy is all about. I loved the class discussions and personal stories.  Yes,  he grades papers hard, b/c if you can't write a good paper,  you're basically screwed in the college world. I highly recommend him.

If you have an undying passion for english, philosophy and trivial knowledge, Dr. White is the professor for you. I enjoyed the class, but most students did not, since he frequently goes off on tangents, discussed topics that are too advanced/controversial for most (be ready to debate God's existence) and grades his papers really hard.

Dr. White is into himself way to much. If you ask a question in class, be prepared for a minimum of 20 minute tangent. His vocabulary is superior, which makes it hard to follow his long winded lextures about himself. The only good thing about his clas is that their are only three papers to write.
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR!!! Does not teach with any clarity whatsoever. He just loves to tell how smart he is and how many people he knows. Seriously, do not take this guy!

WORST PROFESSOR EVER!! He does work well with philosophical beginners. He always rambles on two hour tangents. His grading is unfair and thinks he is an English professor. Whoever said he is alright then you haven't met many professors.
VERY touch professor, even to an "A" student.  Papers are entirely graded on ENGLISH and not philosophy.  TH White will not make logical progressions in papers.

Dr. White takes a real interest in how well you are understanding the material.  If you are interested in Philosophy and you don't mind writing papers about it, Dr. White is a good choice.  The only grades in the class are three 5-7 page papers.  He makes the requirements very clear and grades very fairly as long as you are making a genuine effort.

If you want to take a class that only has 3 papers.. then this is your professor... but BEWARE.. his grading makes no sense. He doesn't explain why you get the grade you get (I swear the flips a coin- Heads = B-,Tails = C+). Take him if you want to take a professor who rambles on about the big name schools he has been too, but I wouldn't suggest it

oh dear god!!!! this man is way too smart to be teaching this class. he has been studying phil for over 40 years. he speaks in riddles and just rambles on during class. you have to attend class b/c he takes role EVERYDAY. do not take this class unless you really like phil and understand every concept in phil...otherwise, run far far away!!!!
Do NOT take this professor. Runs on and on about how he is so smart and blah blah blah. Goes on a lot of tangents. Grades papers very hard. Very boring

this guy is a son of a $#@$#@. doesn't know how to use email. refused to send essay topics to me online when my grandmother died. grades papers very hard. has not taught beginning phil in 10 years and usually teaches grad level at ga tech and emory. please god do not take this horrible creature

This is a fairly easy class but attendance is required. He is very nice, helpful, and open to questions and he understands that it is hard for newcomers to grasp the concept of philosophy. You write only a few short papers that make up your grade.
